title: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText beeps when SWT.MULTI is chosen
description: When selecting the SWT.MULTI option in ControlExampleText, the application emits a beeping sound. This behavior seems incorrect and unintended.
OB: After choosing SWT.MULTI, clicking on other buttons in the application also triggers the beeping sound.
EB: I expect not to hear a Windows 'ding' sound when I select SWT.MULTI, as this sound usually indicates an error or incorrect input.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the ControlExampleText application.
2. Choose the SWT.MULTI option.
3. Click on any other buttons in the application.
4. Observe if the beeping sound is emitted.
